required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Application in the Treatment of Patients With Shoulder Impingement
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Strengthening of Periscapular Muscles With Addition of Neuromuscular Training on the Improvement of Pain and Disability in Patients With Shoulder Impingement: Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluate the effectiveness of adding neuromuscular exercises with tactile, visual and auditory feedback to a strengthening exercises protocol, both emphasizing the periscapular muscles on improvement of disability in patients with shoulder impingement compared to patients receiving only strengthening exercise protocol.

detailed_description.textblock:
Evidence of the effectiveness conservative treatments in shoulder impingement are in favor the application of specific exercises for scapulothoracic muscles and rotator cuff on pain reduction and improvement of upper limb function, supervised or performed at home, and these same exercises associated with other therapies promote a greater reduction in pain and improvement in disability.
There is a lack of clinical trials in the literature that evaluated the effectiveness of neuromuscular control focused on periscapular muscles. The few studies in this area have great methodological diversity with significant limitations. The hypothesis is that patients with shoulder impingement who will receive traditional exercise protocol with the addition of neuromuscular training will show less functional disability, a greater reduction in pain intensity, increase muscle strength and range of motion when compared to the patient group that will receive only the protocol without neuromuscular training, immediately after the intervention, four and eight weeks and four months after randomization and that these benefits are clinically relevant.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in functionality evaluated with specific questionnaire and total score range 0 to 100 points.
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, four and eight weeks and four months after randomization
primary_outcome.description: Portuguese version questionnaire Shoulder Pain and Disability Index. Lower scores indicate better functionality

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intensity of pain evaluated by a scale from 0 to 10
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, four and eight weeks and four months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Pain Numerical Rating Scale. Lower values indicate improvement in pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in strength evaluated by hand held dynamometer and the measures provided in kilogram-force (KgF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, four and eight weeks and four months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Strength of serratus anterior, trapezius muscles, abduction, adduction, internal and external rotation movements the arm with hand held Dynamometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived change evaluated by numerical scale from 11 points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: four, eight weeks and four months of randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Global Perceived Effect Scale. Positive values indicate improvement and negative values indicate worsening of symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in kinesiophobia evaluated with specific questionnaire and final score range 17 to 68 points.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, four and eight weeks and four months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia. High scores indicate high degree kinesiophobia

secondary_outcome.measure: Range of motion evaluated by digital inclinometer and the measures provided in degrees
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, four and eight weeks and four months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: abduction, adduction, internal and external rotation of the shoulder

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with treatment evaluated with specific questionnaire with 13 itens.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: four, eight weeks and four months after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Medrisk Questionnaire. High scores indicate satisfaction with treatment

arm_group.description: Side lying external rotation, prone horizontal abduction , Scapular punch, Knee Push, Full can, D1 Diagonal, three times a week, 8 weeks, 3x10 repetitions
Towel slide, Scapular Clock, PNF scapular, Inferior Glide modified, Scapular Orientation Exercise, protraction and retraction of scapula, three times a week, 8 weeks, 3x10 repetitions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of subacromial impingement with confirmed positivity in at least three of the five specific orthopedic impact tests: Neer test, Hawkins- Kennedy test, painful arc, external rotation resistance and empty can. Present history of pain in the shoulder lasting more than a week located in the proximal area of the shoulder
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a history of trauma or shoulder surgery, total rupture of the rotator cuff tendon and biceps, physically active involving the upper limbs or considered active accordance with the short version International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ). Subjects who have neurological diseases, referred pain in arms (indicative of involvement in the cervical or thoracic region), systemic disease involving the joints such as rheumatoid arthritis or fibromyalgia, the presence of disorders in the wrist such as carpal tunnel syndrome, and have done physical therapy in the last six months.

facility.name: University of São Paulo, Ribeirão Preto Medical School
